author: Roland
title: Make your Dapp visible
description: Soon, there will be a lot of Dapps on the network and will be too difficult to manage them transparently from the stage of development.

assessments.note: Its not clear how this solution solves the problem it is stating. If all the DApps go there then is it no the same problem? If hardly any go there, then will anyone look at it?

While it seems that there may be some controversy regarding competition (ideas etc) I found the proposal effectively addresses the challenge. It is reasonable that two similiar projects can co-exist in the Cardano environment. May even be healthy from an innovation sense.

A central listing for Dapps seems like an important project, although I assume there will be a lot of competition in this field. I'm not sure the team will have the resources to become a dominant hub for Dapp information.  From that perspective, the real impact may be limited.

Having a dapp store is important for enabling potential users to see all other Dapps in the eco-system leading to improved utilization. The issue of plagiarism raised in the comment is not a major issue since it is always better to have a alternate site to improve competition.

The proposal described doesn't clearly demonstrate how it will address the challenge. The idea is to create a website to inform about Cardano's userbase on dapps and development updates and relevant statistics on the projects under development. The proposal is not within the "Potential Directions" set out in the Challenge Brief for this challenge.


The focus in this proposal is not on developers, but on providing information to the userbase about dapps and projects under development.

Although I believe that this proposal has an interesting potential, there is nothing to indicate that it could have a relevant benefit for developers. No targets or metrics were included that indicate impact on this challenge. If we analyze the case of Ethereum where there is a large ecosystem of dapps and projects we realize that there is no central hub to find information about dapps, but  different initiatives and in many cases the projects disclose developments on Twitter or Medium. Using a specific website ends up restricting the reach.
Yes, however it would help I'd the writer explained more clearly what 'They can manage profiles more easily' means in the solution statement.
The plan could have more detail on how it will actually deal with the problem of lots of DApps. How are they filtered? How does it solve the problem of too many DApps?

The team appears to have the necessary skillset to implement this limited proposal. It would be good to read further about each member and provide examples of product/design in addition to the website.

The qualifications given are not verifiable. However, the funds requested are modest and the implementation not particularly difficult. The question is whether the platform can gain users and network effect. Marketing experience and strategy would make the proposal more convincing.
The team of three has a developer and a general organizer. The proposers are also hosting Cardano Stake Pool. The proposal is simple, and the team will implement the proposal in the right earnest.

The team describes experiences in Web development, project and business management, but this is insufficient to indicate their aptitude to execute this proposal.

In the link "https://adaption.us/about-us" there is more information about the team, but only vague descriptions. To assess the feasibility of the team implementing a proposal we need solid evidence of expertise and links / references to previous work.

There is no budget breakdown. The plan needs to be better structured, there is no roadmap.

I recommend that the team develops the proposal based on the Catalyst documentation.
There is sufficient information in the ongoing project section and link to website provided.
It is not clear how it will solve the problem it is posing.

The information provided was sufficient and the idea is feasible. Greater detail about team members, a more detailed budget and possibly future aspects as I feel that this is a project in the early stages.

The 3500 in funds will be used to build the web platform. This includes Dapp listings, a news feed, and statistics. No time frame is given.  A specific time frame for each stage would improve my rating.
The progress can be easily audited simply and openly. The number of apps listed and the quality of the site will be in the open domain.

There are not enough details about the team, budget allocation or roadmap.

There are no reasonable KPIs or metrics.

The deliverables described are subjective. I recommend that you give more details on what will be the videos and catalogs described in the proposal.
Yes, the proposer aims to gather ongoing feedback via surveys to measure success.

solution: The solution is Adaption! A platform where developers can submit Dapps and reach more users via a website. They can manage profiles easily.
experience: Web development, project and business management.
